content: of the front of foot just check that inside each marker at each end of the front of foot stitches there is a purl stitch shape instep/gusset next you will need to decrease stitches either side of the foot to shape a gusset that will bring your stitch numbers back to more or less what you had on the leg do this as follows round 1 k to 3 sts before 1st marker k2tog k1 slip marker p1 k4 p1 4 5 6 5 6 times across the front of the foot slip marker k1 ssk k to end of round round 2 k to marker slip marker p1 k4 p1 4 5 6 5 6 times across the front of the foot slip marker k to end of round repeat these 2 rnds until only 40 45 50 55 60 sts remain foot continue working foot with no decreases exactly as round 2 above on instep until foot is desired length minus approx 2 5 inches 6 5 cm toe all of the toe will be in stockinette stocking stitch so the top of foot patterns stops here for sizes small & large only you need to decrease a stitch so that there is an even number of stitches for the toe do this as follows extra small medium and extra large sizes only k1 round with no decreases small & large sizes only next round k to marker remove marker ssk k to 2 sts before next marker k2tog remove marker knit to end of round this should mean your stitch count should now be 40 44 50 54 60 sts in total k 2 more rnds straight i e no decreases in stockinette stocking stitch divide your stitches so that there are 20 22 35 27 30 sts for the top of foot and 20 22 35 27 30 sts for the bottom of the foot put one marker at the beginning of the top of foot and mark this as new beg of round and one marker at the end of the top of foot stitches knit around to the beginning of the top of the foot stitches i e your new beginning of round and decrease for toe shaping as follows 4 next round *k1 ssk k to last 3 sts before 1st marker k2tog k1 slip marker repeat from * to end of foot/second marker repeat above round until 20 20 22 22 24 sts remain to close the toe you will need to graft top and bottom stitches together using kitchener stitch this is quite easy even if the name sounds scary this is how you do it kitchener stitch to graft toe seams put 10 10 11 11 12 sts from top of foot onto one needle put 10 10 11 11 12 sts from bottom of foot onto another needle hold stitches/needles parallel to each other with needles side to side and ws together thread yarn tail through tapestry
